quizzes.title: Frontend Development Basics - Level 1
quizzes.description: Fundamental concepts of frontend development including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript basics

questions.question_text: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.question_text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to set the color of text in CSS.

questions.question_text: Which JavaScript method is used to add an element to the end of an array?
questions.explanation: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of CSS?
questions.explanation: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and layout web pages, controlling the visual appearance.

options.text: To style and layout web pages
To add interactivity to web pages

questions.question_text: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag (anchor tag) is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.question_text: What is React primarily used for?
questions.explanation: React is a JavaScript library primarily used for building user interfaces, especially for single-page applications.

questions.question_text: Which CSS property is used to make text bold?
questions.explanation: The font-weight property is used to set the thickness/boldness of text in CSS.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the <script> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <script> tag is used to embed or reference JavaScript code in an HTML document.

options.text: To embed or reference JavaScript code

quizzes.title: Frontend Development Intermediate - Level 2
quizzes.description: Intermediate frontend concepts including React, state management, and advanced CSS

questions.question_text: What is a React Hook?
questions.explanation: React Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components.

options.text: A way to connect to external APIs
A function that lets you use state and lifecycle features

questions.question_text: What is CSS Grid primarily used for?
questions.explanation: CSS Grid is a layout system designed for creating two-dimensional layouts with rows and columns.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between let and const in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: let allows reassignment, while const prevents reassignment after initialization.

options.text: let allows reassignment, const does not
const allows reassignment, let does not
let is for functions, const is for variables

quizzes.title: Data Science Fundamentals
quizzes.description: Core concepts of data science, statistics, and machine learning

questions.question_text: Which Python library is primarily used for data manipulation and analysis?
questions.explanation: Pandas is the primary library for data manipulation and analysis in Python, built on top of NumPy.

questions.question_text: What does 'overfitting' mean in machine learning?
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns the training data too well, including noise, making it perform poorly on unseen data.

options.text: Model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
Model performs poorly on all data
Model is too simple to capture patterns

questions.question_text: What is cross-validation used for?
questions.explanation: Cross-validation is a technique to evaluate model performance by training and testing on different subsets of data.

options.text: To assess how well a model will generalize to unseen data

quizzes.title: Cybersecurity Basics
quizzes.description: Fundamental concepts of cybersecurity, threats, and protection methods

questions.question_text: What is a phishing attack?
questions.explanation: Phishing is a social engineering attack where attackers trick users into revealing sensitive information.

options.text: A social engineering attack via email or messaging

questions.question_text: What does HTTPS provide that HTTP does not?
questions.explanation: HTTPS provides encryption and authentication, securing data transmission between client and server.

questions.question_text: What is a firewall used for?
questions.explanation: A firewall monitors and controls network traffic based on predefined security rules.

options.text: To monitor and control network traffic

quizzes.title: Healthcare Administration Basics
quizzes.description: Introduction to healthcare administration, medical terminology, and healthcare systems

questions.question_text: What is HIPAA?
questions.explanation: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) protects patient health information privacy.

options.text: A law protecting patient health information privacy

questions.question_text: What does EMR stand for?
questions.explanation: EMR stands for Electronic Medical Record, a digital version of a patient's paper chart.

quizzes.title: Accounting Fundamentals
quizzes.description: Basic accounting principles, financial statements, and bookkeeping

questions.question_text: What is the accounting equation?
questions.explanation: The fundamental accounting equation is Assets = Liabilities + Equity.

questions.question_text: What is double-entry bookkeeping?
questions.explanation: Double-entry bookkeeping requires every transaction to have equal debits and credits.

options.text: Every transaction has equal debits and credits
Recording both cash and credit sales

quizzes.title: Teaching Fundamentals
quizzes.description: Basic principles of teaching, classroom management, and educational methodologies

questions.question_text: What is differentiated instruction?
questions.explanation: Differentiated instruction involves tailoring teaching methods to meet individual student needs and learning styles.

options.text: Teaching the same way to all students
Tailoring teaching to individual student needs

quizzes.title: Retail Sales Basics
quizzes.description: Fundamental skills for retail sales, customer service, and product knowledge

questions.question_text: What is the first step in the sales process?
questions.explanation: The first step is typically greeting the customer and establishing rapport.
